The maximum possible number of three-term arithmetic progressions in a monotone sequence of \( n \) distinct reals is \boxed{\left\lfloor \dfrac{n}{2} \right\rfloor \left\lfloor \dfrac{n-1}{2} \right\rfloor}.

sentence: A three-term AP is defined by three terms \( a_i, a_j, a_k \) such that \( 2a_j = a_i + a_k \).
